Replies.Reply: A sleek, futuristic LIMOUSINE pulls up and TUXEDO gets in the back. They're gone in an instant.
I'm not really in the mood for opera, Armando.
You read my mind. Let's not mention this to my Dad...
I can find my way back.
Get lost, meatbag.
Get lost, meatbag.
F Street?
I work for Dr. Canter. His private elevator's this way.
I gave the police a statement.
Dr. Canter's rules.
I'll show you out.
We got a problem here?
You're gonna have to leave, sir.
Are you OK?
You asshole. I just made the last payment.
This is a private club.
I just need to talk to--
Mind if I join you?
Let's call for back-up.
IT'S PROTOCOL--
Is this Kathy Welles...? My name is Jennifer Peters, with the FBI's surrogate crime division...
I don't recommend reconnecting, Ms. Welles... hello?
Your insurance ought to cover it.
Abandoned.
Musta cracked when she fell.
There's a second?
Maybe he's real.
Looks like the optics exploded...
I'll call for a pick-up. Maybe diagnostics can make sense of it.
You always work these kind of hours?
Besides sleep?
Are we actually listening to the Prophet? We oughta lock this guy up and throw away the key.
So is this "know thine enemy?"
You're kidding, right? The Dreads've gotta be behind half the crimes against surries nationwide--
D. C.'s the heart of the action, right? Plus my ex and I were in the same office, it got a little uncomfortable.
You get along with your last partner?
You sound pleased.
Thought you took your job seriously. Surrogates are extensions of people's selves--
The Supreme Court.
Synthetic units have the same rights as biologicals.
That's humanist propaganda. The restricted areas were their idea, they hate being around surries.
What could do that to someone?
He's a "meatbag" all right. Look at those scars...
We're federal agents.
You're the one who drove Anthony Canter that night?
Nice place.
Yes we are.
We're very sorry for your loss, sir.
Wait, how is that possible?
We're still analyzing the damage--
We really can't get into the details of an ongoing investigation--
Can you think of anyone who might want to harm your son?
Can you imagine what it's like to lose your only child?
Jim and I talked about it, but...
So we're talking mistaken T.D.
My money's on the Dreads.
Excuse me, the "humans."
Thank you.
She's a little over the top.
It's delicious, if you want it to be.
Thanks for taking the time to see us.
Not at all. I didn't get your names--?
A massive brain hemmorhage, it happened while he was online.
What's our take-away?
You mean before they all became lawyers?
We were told you could help us with some technical issues.
Ever seen anything like it before?
No bullet holes, no blast damage--?
Those soldiers we saw--
Think he's telling the truth?
We're exploring every avenue, Dr.
I understand you're grieving--
I appreciate your concern and frustration, obviously we all want immediate results, but--
Where'd you get this?
Try narrowing the search for Dread affiliation...
Jack Strickland, one of the Prophet's groupies... torched a surrogate display at a department store--
No known address...
He can cut off operators from here?
You're not a surrogate, are you?
Jennifer Peters.
What are you doing?
You need to get approval!
Got a hit on the bike, half a mile from the rez, check your screen.
Knock knock.
It's me, Peters, don't you recognize me?
A pleasure to meet you. Jennifer Peters.
His new partner.
Thanks...
I think.
You look just like your unit.
You've been through a lot.
It's not your fault. You were doing your job.
It's the murder weapon?
It's OK. Nothing's gonna happen.
Just take my arm.
We need to get you a replacement.
We can try a department store--
Well, you made it a block.
Come here often, stranger?
I don't like the way you're looking at me.
Yeah yeah, this is just a lump of aluminum and polystyrene. Tell you what, next time you're in Colorado, look me up for real. We can have a beer together.
New job, I was defensive.
I can get you home.
You seem better already.
Where you going?
Jesus, Tom, the rez?
Be careful.
Got your message.
After what happened here today I couldn't sleep.
No. Of course not.
You look terrible.
No thanks.
You look like you need it.
Relax. It's not me, it's not a woman touching you-- it's just a machine.
What.
We always think technology's going to improve our lives, but...
Maybe not. I have a feeling people are going to come to their senses eventually.
I found out about Strickland.
All the chaos, I was able to waltz right into the records department.
The case files were removed, but there was a paper trail from payroll... Strickland was an informant.
Wasn't in the paperwork. But he must've been selling intel on the Prophet.
What you working on?
I think you hide things from me.
What does AOS stand for? I keep coming across it on these invoices. "Advance On Salary?"
Against him? He's one of them.
'Course, since he owns the patents on surrogate technology, they must have to pay him billions.
Wait a minute. You think VSI hired Strickland to kill Canter?
Sure, the extremist wing of the anti-surrogate movement.
What? The father of surrogacy?
Swiss accounts, anonymous wire transfers, unattributed testimony--

He's not some kind of monster, you know. Canter's initial research was in prosthetics-- for amputees, quadriplegics... people with degenerative diseases. Maybe he feels his technology's been perverted. Maybe it has.
Isn't that what you called it?
So what do we do about Stone?
That isn't funny.
I don't believe you-- they killed Canter's son, a college kid, his whole life ahead of him! Don't we owe him something?
They will come after Canter again--
I thought you were a cop. I thought you were a human being.
Who was it, Stone? Who was it at VSI that hired you to kill me?
Did you feel even a second of remorse, when you found out you'd murdered an innocent boy. He was eighteen!
Just tell me what I need to know.
An eye for an eye...
They're fine.
How do I shut it down?
Bobby, this is Agent Greer!
Where'.s the sport in that?
You have the right to remain silent--
Stay with me asshole--
Nah, go back to work.
He's a rental.
--trash pick-up on Maple and 4th.
Any ID from the rental agency?
Harry P. Ness.
You think?
Or something happened to the operator.
Registered to a Cameron Michaels, out in Clarksburg...
You call her?
Optics are damaged.
A tux? Kind of over-dressed for a jacker joint.
Little too pretty for that.
He's synth all right.
So much for the identity chip.
Clarksburg's just up the 270, let's talk to our witness.
Got something better to do?
Welcome back.
The Human Coalition isn't "the enemy."
"Dreads..."
Sounds like they're doing a bang-up job out there. Why'd you transfer?
Till he retired. Had no idea he was that old.
Nothing to worry about.
Who does?
Hello?
Call the paramedics.
Not cool.
It's OK. Come in--
Put him up. I was about to get some sleep.
Some poor cross-sexual had an aneurysm while he was online, had to get him to a hospital.
Bedsores? Want me to take a look?
Well, there's room on the credit card.
It's been a while since... we've actually been together.
No, I just meant--
But that's our surrogates. It's not the same...
I was thinking more like a vacation. An island somewhere.
I mean a real vacation-- just us.
Tuxedo's operator turned up, student at Yale name of Anthony Canter...
They're uploading his memory file.
Well, you get a little tired of property crime, vandalism--
What are you, quoting VSI?
Yeah, yeah. Fact is, most of the people you refer to as Dreads are just too poor to afford a synth.
Poor kid. Pathologist said his brains looked like soup.
Two people in a narrow alley, surrounded by fire escapes, cell towers...?
Is he the perp, or just some lookie-loo--?
What you got?
You still thinking lightning?
is this necessary?
Kid liked the wild side, huh. Did his father know?
Canter must get a piece of every surrogate they sell.
Dr. Canter?
I can't help noticing, your surrogate-- it's very similar to the unit your son was using...
Dr. Canter-- we don't know of any way to kill an operator remotely.
Guess the interview's over.
Not really. You got kids?
Lot of that going around.
If he thinks of anything else.
Someone targeted Canter's surrie, got the wrong operator.
I'm sure the guy's got enemies he never even heard of.
Damn. Why didn't I think of that?
Just advertising the product.
Ugh.
Right, I keep forgetting that.
Mmm. So good.
Our immediate superior.
Mm. Any idea what could cause a surrogate's head to explode from the inside?
Not much. He's dead.
No one's talking lawsuit. we'd just like to know, is there any precedent for an operator being killed by signals from his synth unit?
There is one more thing. The victim was Anthony Canter. The son of one of your company's founders.
Kind of a strange coincidence.
I used to be able to read people, back when they were people...
You made a joke. Maybe there's hope for you, Peters...
Mr. Waters? Seth Waters?
We're with the FBI.
May we take a look?
Brand new camos, no mud, no dirt...
So no such thing exists?
Not when his lips are moving.
Sir, we are not at liberty to comment on an ongoing investigation.
You handled that well.
The freak who was working the door at the club. Got a look at our perp dead-on.
Eighty-seven percent match. Close enough for government work.
And they let him off?
Not a problem.
Ever come down here? It's like being inside God's head...
They've been trying to puppet Bobby for years--
Ten minutes ago? Where?
Stay here, keep tabs on him.
Getting a chopper.
We're close! Noise suppression!
Ignore her, Lopez. Get us as close as you can.
Jesus, what is that?
He gets through the gate, we can't touch him.
Pull up, Lopez, pull up!
You're a killer--
You really don't know?
Strickland! Wait!
I'm a federal agent--
Maggie! Wake up!
Please, I need your help... open the door!
Would you do that?
Get a surrogate for our kid. Our hypothetical kid.
It just seems weird to me.
Who's there.-
I thought you might've been telling another joke.
Except older and fatter. Sorry if I seem a little out of it.
They're calling it a concussion--
You tell me. How's Lopez?
None of us did! We still don't know. I don't think Strickland even knew-- he thought he was just taking down "the abominations."
I've been going through my memory files of the crash... ever seen anything like this before?
We need to get this guy.
They said the end of the week--
What about my surrogate?
I haven't been out without a surrogate in a long time...
They wanted to give me something for the anxiety... they call it corporeaphobia.
Jesus Christ.
I like to see my own face when I look in the mirror.
No. I'm a grown man for Chrissake, I should be able to walk down the street without completely freaking out.
Here's to self-medication.
What is this?
You have any real booze?
You know, they really don't look human. You can't tell when you're inside them, but...
But I'm not really looking at you.
I'd like that.
You know, when we started working together, I thought you were kind of a stiff.
It's more than that... you're different. Or maybe I am.
You probably oughta head back to the office.
I'll be OK.
I'm thinking you should double-
It's like riding a bike.
It's a lovely day. Thought I'd take a trip to East Baltimore.
Was it always this steep?
Since I'm stuck in my skin, I oughta take advantage of it. Hell, as long as Strickland has that device-- I'm safer this way.
I'm sure.
Just a little carsick.
Where would I find the, the what do you call it, the Temple?
Thanks.
Catch a lotta surries tryin' to sneak in, do ya?
Excuse me.
Excuse me. You wouldn't happen to know a Jack Strickland? I'm told he worked here off and on.
What happened to Jack Strickland?
I'd like a word with the Prophet.
Strickland was carrying a weapon.
Needs repairs.
Frisk me if you want.
I'm starting to see your point.
I'm not a Dread.
Who are you?
Canter?
You're having me followed.
The man who killed your son is dead.
I suppose you deserve that.
Why not? You stand for everything the humanists hate--
He'd outlived his usefulness.
Presumably.
OK, fine. Maybe we've got our heads up our own ass--
So now you're the victim of a government conspiracy?
You really don't need to do my job for me.
Obviously. You know I don't like you jacking in the house.
Just finding out how the other half lives.
So what's his name?
I suppose it doesn't matter. Since, as you keep telling me, it doesn't mean anything. Nothing does.
Alive. Is that what they are out there?
Of course not.
Excuse me.
Guess the party's over.
Does everything have to have a point?
I'm sorry. I just want us to-- to connect again. To have a family, to have a life.
We can't do it through this wall of plastic.
In the flesh.
Saw it on TV.
Mm. Just cleaning out my desk.
Nice of you to notice. You remember where the rest rooms are?
Hope I didn't wake you.
You tell anyone I was going out to the rez? Canter, for example?
Not half as bad as I feel.
Come on. Just pretend to get drunk with me.
Feel like I've been asleep for years-- now I wake up an old man.
What are you doing?
I'm not sure how kosher this is...
Does feel good... better than a stim chair.
You ever feel like it's... over?
Us. People. The stuff that used to make the world make sense.
What lives?
This has become obsolete. Someday soon, we'll all just be brains in jars.
You can't unring a bell.
Thought you were the one all into the brave new world.
For us? Who was running him?
So the Prophet has him killed. And we have to assume he now has the power to kill anyone he wants...
It's from my memory. Damn thing put me in the hospital.
Killed a couple of cops as well.
I was hoping you'd tell me.
Not this one. Maybe it never got to you guys in the first place.
You win the battle with one shot.
Let me guess. You found a way around the fail-safes.
So it's an assassination tool.
Worked late. I'd really like to sit down and talk with you.
No, Maggie, face to face. The two of us, for real.
Honey, if you're worried about the way you look-- it doesn't matter, it never did--
I married a person, you're choosing to be a thing.
And I'm so sick of being surrounded by things-- young, beautiful things.
Because it's bullshit. Because we're human, like it or not.
I may just have to kick down your bedroom door.
Then maybe I should just move out.
That's a commercial.
Just checking e-mail.
Don't be ridiculous.
This stuff is awful.
What do you suppose VSI has against Canter?
He dies, they still have to pay his estate.
There was a middleman.
To authorize informant payments, agent in charge has to initial...
Just cleaning out my desk.
Just about done, sir.
I almost forgot. Victor Welch sends his regards.
Guy at VSI. You looking forward to moving to the private sector--?
Will you finish out the year? We're sure gonna miss you around here...
I know it's hard to resist, better hours, better pay--
No. I was just fishing.
All surveillance on the Prophet goes through this office. Jack Strickland was one of your stoolies.
--because you gave it to him.
Not quite. What I can't figure out is why. Why kill Canter?
Just meet me in the garage-- leave the trunk open!
Ever hear of the Human Defense League?
According to this, their number one supporter is Lionel Canter.
Says he's funneled billions into their organization. Not to mention direct support for the man who calls himself the Prophet.
Not enough for a courtroom. But VSI knew that if Lionel Canter suffered a mysterious brain hemmorhage, the powers that be wouldn't be terribly upset.
I had no idea you were such a humanist.
Colonel Brandon didn't waste any time.
The what?
Overload Device.
I call and tell him I'll take early retirement with full pension benefits. In return for keeping his little secret.
I'm not laughing.
Can't bring him back.
Maybe he's got it coming.
I'm only gonna be there a couple hours.
Generic's fine.
Who's on duty in surveillance--?
It's an emergency, you need to connect me now!
Bobby, it's Greer, I need a remote shutdown. You'll have the surrie's digital address on file, Agent Jennifer Peters.
I wouldn't be. I'm here to arrest him.
Listen to me. Dr. Canter is committing a crime via surrogate--
Ow! Easy, I'm only human.
The elevator key!
Damn it!
You're insane.
She's dead.
You bastard, she was my partner, I cared about her--
Shut up!
How many people are you? You're really the Prophet?
Why...?
You created them.
What's going to happen?
No--!
Maggie--?
Maggie, it's me.
It's OK, it's OK...
Ssh. It's just us now.
Why would I do that?
Am I in trouble?
Aw crap, I'm totalled!
Coulda just called it in, we'd a shut him down from here--
Yeah, got a name from their office in Miami. Ness, Harold P.
Oh. False ID?
Don't be in a rush to get home, Tom. Two surries down outside The Pit, hard-core club on F street.
Left a message.
Couldn't get an ID from this one.
You feel you are free. You can be what you want, do what you want, nothing can hurt you. But you have ceased to live.
You think you control your surrogates, but it is they who have taken over your lives. You lie in your cells, pale and fat prisoners, while the puppets walk and dance and make love...
.But this I promise: soon the abominations shall fall where they stand... and on that day of resurrection, the dead shall rise...
You've been keeping secrets, Jack.
This is unfair to your brother humans.
I know what you've done. What I don't know is-- who hired you to betray us? I want a name.
Jack...
--serving faithfully beside us in the cause of humanity. _I had the privilege of hearing his confession shortly before his death.
And I know he would have rejoiced in the day of resurrection, the day for which we are all preparing, the day I promise you is close at hand...
Well, maybe I'll just have to bring it to their doorstep...
Have no fear, the day of resurrection is at hand!
No! Do not resist! The oppressors shall soon fall, never to rise again...
I been having problems with my surrie, this is just a loaner. Is there some kind of trouble?
Cam's a good tenant, y'know. Pays the rent on time, never leaves the apartment...
Cam? Wake up, the police are here to talk to you...
Oh my God, Cameron--
Wake up! Wake up! Zombies!
Wake up and smell the piss!
Oh, sorry--
But where's your...
You just get in?
I think I need a new stim chair.
No thanks, it's just some irritation.
Are you talking about sex?
Because I think we're doing just fine.
It's better.
I wish that instead of working every night, you would come out with me, go dancing, we used to have such a good time--
Bridget said she got an amazing deal on a surrie rental in Tahiti--
And get on a plane?
Sleep well.
BRB, I just gotta change. Little black dress or red bustier?
Oh my God.
Hm? Do what?
Sure. Why not? They're getting cheaper all the time.
Our grandparents thought seatbelts were weird.
Not like it's an issue.
Hi. I'm Maggie, Tom's wife.
You should have mentioned her. I need to get going anyway, I'll let you two talk business.
I'm a beauty engineer. Drop by the shop sometime, I'll give you a free consultation.
For what?
Mm. A spaceship. Or a cloud.
Excuse me.
What happened to you? I thought you were-spending another night in the hospital.
Somebody beat you up? How could you go out like that?
What were you thinking, Tom? You.
Oh please, grow up.
I don't expect you to understand this. But once in a while, I like to be around people who don't hate being alive.
Tom, the table!
What was the point of that?
I'm sorry, too. But this is my life.
Boop-oop-a-doop.
You talked her down, I hope.
I'd love you to raise my cheekbones a half-inch, but Tom would go ballistic.
I didn't hear you come home last night.
I can take a break--
Tom, don't you get it? That body in our apartment-- the one you call real--- it isn't me. I'm right here.
Exactly! What matters is who I choose to be.
Well that's your problem, isn't it. if you can be young and beautiful and feel good all the time-- why would anyone choose anything else?
Jesus, Tom. You sound like a Dread.
I'd never forgive you.
Do what you want...
No! Please no, don't look at me...
No Tom, I don't want you to...
No it's not...
Get a room, you two.
Lightning strike, according to forensics. A massive power surge shoots through the network...
Got a better idea? In any case, let's be discreet about this.
Stone here. Under no circumstances do you discuss this matter with anyone, inside or outside the Bureau. Got me?
How ya' feeling, Greer?
The pilot? They found him dead in his stim chair. Same with one of the Baltimore cops, other's in a coma. Four Dreads were killed on the ground, half a dozen wounded.
I'm sorry, Greer,. but- - you're suspended, pending further action.

It's more than that. It means nobody is safe. The Dreads want us all to be like them-- living in fear, no better than animals. And we've only just freed ourselves, begun to explore our true potential.
We will. Our way of life will be protected, whatever it takes.
Just take some time to heal.
Hasn't been-recovered. I'm afraid we can't supply you with a new one until this matter is resolved.
Greer! You've been cleaning out your desk for two days. You should be home recuperating.
I'm sorry?
Welch told you about this?
You've suffered brain damage, Greer.
Are you done with this paranoid fantasy--?
I'm issuing orders for your detention. Your mind isn't right, you've become a threat to national security.
This is Stone!
Sonofabitch Greer disabled my surrie, stop him!
Why the hell don't you just move in and take her down?
That fat ass Sanders.
Peters! It's me, Andy Stone!
I don't believe it...
We spend years trying to nail you for funding the Dreads-- and now you hand yourself over to us on a silver platter. Hijacking an agent, destroying federal property, creating a hostage situation...
I wouldn't add homicide to that list. As it is, you're going to prison for a very long time.
Next of kin. You sitting down?
Yes, sir.
Dr. Canter is expecting you. But no weapons are permitted in the penthouse.
I'm sorry. You'll have to leave them with me.
I'm sorry, you're not on his list.
I see... do you have a warrant?
Without a warrant, I'm afraid I can't help you.
I'm calling the police.
That's right. You're with the FBI.
What progress have you made with the investigation?
I wrote the code that remains at the core of all surrogates. It wasn't difficult for me to make my synth units accessible to my son.
I suppose...
The coroner says that Tony was online when it happened. Why hasn't the surrogate been returned to me?
It was attacked?
No, but-- at the beginning, all of us at VSI were worried about it.
I... the sad fact is, Tony and I were just getting to know each other... he grew up with his mother in California.
If this wasn't an accident... then it's because of me that he's...
I'm sorry. You'll have to excuse me.
Tell me, have you made any progress whatsoever?
Don't blow me off like I'm some goddamn reporter. I have resources of my own, do I have to do your jobs for you?
What. What are you doing?
I'm a target for assassination! I assume you're at least aware of that.
I've heard enough of your condescending pap. The people who did this are going to be punished.
Jennifer Peters. Is she--
I had no intention of hurting her.
Did you? You barely knew her. It was me you came to care about--
I had to fight VSI any way I could.
There's nothing you can do--
You understand...
You could have stopped it. Thank you...
You know why. I won't be responsible for the death of humanity. I like the way you put it-- unringing a bell.
I only sought to give people like me the chance to live normal lives.
The day of resurrection.
.Dr. Lionel Canter's breakthrough experiments led to the technology for decoding brain impulses and transferring the signals to synthetic humans...
Mr. Welch will be with you in a minute.
Agents Greer and Peters? I'm Victor Welch, VP corporate relations.
No problem. Do you happen to know Andy Stone?
Really. Do give him my regards--
You might be interested in a free software upgrade we're offering to all law enforcement officials, better night vision for your synth unit, improved pursuit capability...
If that's all... a pleasure talking with you.
Dr. Canter has retired, but we'll be sure to send our condolences.
We're from the legal department.
Mr. Welch isn't qualified to answer that question. You'd be better off speaking to one of our technicians.
Surries have jumped from bridges, been shot or blown to bits without the least harm to the operators-
Hope you don't mind if we sit in.
What does the operator say?
I'm sorry to hear that. But I can assure you it has nothing to do with VSI products. If a man suffers a heart attack while driving, he doesn't have a case against the automobile manufacturer.
The idea is absurd. If it were possible, it would defeat the purpose of surrogacy.
We can't help it if customers forget to eat, sleep or take their medicine.
Hello, sorry. I was in the can.
To whom am I addressing myself?
Really? Cool.
Heat build-up like this? Every circuit musta fired at once.
Not exactly... but last week we got a truckload of GI Joes back for reconditioning. Couple a the surries were missing optics.
Old soldiers never die...
Here we go.
Not a scratch.
Didn't come back with one. I thought it was a little weird.
I'm down, I'm down!
Yessir.
Damn things aren't free, Pulaski.
Yeah, I'll be right over.
Keep an eye on Bravo company.
The United States has the largest surrogate army in.the world. Why on earth would the defense department want to develop a weapon that could wipe out our own troops?
If it did, I'd know about it.
We routinely remove motherboards and optics for analysis. Now if you'll excuse me, we're in the middle of a peacekeeping operation.
Bill, we may have a problem. Is it possible one of our ODs is loose?
Where'd you get this photo?
Wish I could help.
If this is true... we're going to have to do everything in our-power to recover it. Do you have any idea how serious this is?
This is absolutely off the record.
It's called an Overload Device, or O.D. They're brand new, only a handful exist. But I checked, ran every serial number-- all accounted for.
It's a DARPA design, subcontracted to Pierson Defense. The idea was to create a non-lethal weapon that could disable every surrie in the field.
Just a few lines of code, the connection stays open. We tried it on soldier volunteers... once. The virus caused every neuron to fire at the same time. Melted their brains.
At the flick of a switch.
Back on-line.
We will kick some ass, sir.
Burglary in progress, Charlie4639-
Warrant received.
Anybody, anywhere. Ssh, don't tell anyone. It's a gray area legally.
Relax, we're the good guys.
No ma'am, you're looking at the genuine article. Bobby Sanders.
Baltimore, corner of Eastern and Decker. Got a feeling he's headed for the reservation.
You really look like your surrie?
Don't be so touchy. I'm engaged to B-47 down there.
Peters, have you gone insane?
She's into the entire surrie database, I dunno what she's--
Are they dead?
You...
OK... the software from that thing's already in the system, you have to abort transmission.
Sure, but it has to disconnect the operators first.
So people aren't in any danger...
Their surrogates are! Hurry up!
Do it!
.maybe I'm not done with the O.D. Maybe you're not gonna get it back at all. Guy could have a lot of fun with your little toy...
Oh my G-god-- why? What do you people want from me?!
They were just surries! Goddamn machines!
No, Prophet, I---
Please, I haven't done anything...
I-- I swear to God I don't know--
He never said his name, we talked on disposable cellphones-- I've never even seen his face! I couldn't tell you who he was if my life depended it!
Greer clicks off the radio, turns to Lopez.
Freeze!
You're an abomination.
--we're talking turquoise! I wouldn't carry a purse that color, much less a whole new skin.
Bustier.
